description: From French Pompadour, after Madame de Pompadour (1721–1764), mistress of Louis XV.

entries.meaning: A women's hairstyle in which the hair is swept upwards from the face and worn high over the forehead.

examples: […]  head, neck, and whole under parts fine but very deep crimson or pompadour-colour  […]

entries.meaning: A corsage with low square neck.
A pattern for silk, with leaves and flowers in pink, blue, and gold.
(UK, military, slang, historical) A member of the 56th (West Essex) Regiment of Foot, an infantry regiment in the British Army, active from 1755 to 1881.

verbs.description: pompadour (third-person singular simple present pompadours, present participle pompadouring, simple past and past participle pompadoured)

entries.meaning: To style hair into a pompadour
